thread.title: Manchester bomb: Hustings tonight called off after 'appalling'...

author: Guy_Henderson
title: Manchester bomb: Hustings tonight called off after 'appalling'...

organizations.name: newton abbot chamber of trade at the university technical college

text:
A Hustings debate scheduled to take place in Newton Abbot tonight has been called off in the wake of the Manchester terrorist outrage. The town's parliamentary candidates had been due to meet at St Paul's Church Hall. 
The meeting will now take place on Wednesday May 31 at the same venue, starting at 7.30pm. 
READ MORE: Devon is a wasteland full of whingers and it smells 
A spokesman for the event said: 'In the light of the appalling events that took place in Manchester on Monday night and the decision of the main parties to suspend campaigning on Tuesday, it seems to us right that we should postpone the hustings that were to take place tonight.' 
The Herald Express and DevonLive are also shining the spotlight on Torbay's general election candidates. 
We have teamed up with the Princess Theatre in Torquay and the Torbay Business Forum to stage a special hustings event.The Bay candidates — Labour's Paul Raybould, Liberal Democrat Deborah Brewer, Kevin Foster of the Conservatives, UKIP's Tony McIntyre and Sam Moss of the Green Party — have all agreed to attend the hustings at the venue on Wednesday May 31 starting at 5.30pm. Forum chairman Tim Godfrey and Herald Express editor Jim Parker will chair it. 
READ MORE: A giant adult-only inflatable play day is heading to Devon 
The Business Forum will also be staging it own hustings with the candidates as part of its business breakfast at the Riviera International Conference Centre in Torquay on Tuesday June 6 from around 8.15am. 
Hustings events across South Devon will give people a chance to hear the views of candidates standing in the General Election on June 8. Candidates can expect to be quizzed on a wide range of topics including the economy, education, the NHS, Brexit and immigration. 
There will be a hustings event at Dartington Hall tomorrow night with the Totnes constituency candidates on the panel. Tickets for this event have sold out. On Tuesday May 30 there will be a Newton Abbot hustings organised by the Newton Abbot Chamber of Trade at the University Technical College at 6.30pm.
